history.content: EE 127 is definitely not a lighter course. That being said though. I think Sahai prefers that you have finished 126 and 127 before taking 189 with him. While I personally don't think it's necessary to complete either of those courses before 189, I think Prof. Sahai could change things up a bit next semester and make it so that you'll have a much easier time if you have taken those courses, so I'd say for for 127.

children.subject:
2. Workload is roughly the same for both courses; one (fairly heavy) problem set due every two weeks.

1. I took 189 and then took 127 after; I personally really liked this approach as 127 is a higher level course than 189, so having taken 189, I was much more comfortable with the math in 127, allowing me to focus on the main higher-level ideas. Prof Sahai has said that he prefers students to have taken 126 + 127 before 189 tho, so keep that in mind if you're thinking of taking his 189 next semester.

I don't think there's necessarily a wrong answer here. They're both great courses; one thing I will add is that you will almost definitely gain more from the second of the two courses you take (just because you'll be more experienced when you take it); that's something worth keeping in mind when deciding.
+1 to EE127 not necessarily being a lighter course
+1 ee 127 is a tough course man

history.content:
I'm debating whether to take CS 189 or EE 127 next semester. Prof. Sahai is a great lecturer and I might regret not taking 189 with him. However, he is also notorious for heavy workloads and as I'm taking a few other techs it might not be manageable. Also, in my research, the Prof. wants to apply deep learning, so I maybe should learn ML as early as possible?

On the other hand, EE 127 might be a lighter course (not sure). That's really my main reason for taking EE 127 first.

1) Which do you suggest I take in this fall semester?

2) How does workload of 189 compare to that of 127?
history.subject: EE 127 vs CS 189?
